name: Ritz-Carlton San Juan Hotel, Spa & Casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well reading the reviews about the Atlantis in the bahamas made me look for a alternative vacation, so I thought why not puerto rico its non-stop from chicago no change of planes no hassles thru customs but I have never been. I read the reviews of the Ritz and said why not well my wife said it was her best vacation yet and we go to Hawaii every year. We spent three nights and all were fun and relaxing, took in the spa and the pool not very crowded, to in the weight room and trainer services, part of resort fee but paid that thru expedia. If you are looking for first class treatment take a few days and go to the Ritz in Puerto Rico you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Fun and Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First let me say that this was our 1st time staying at a Ritz property. It was beautiful. There is staff EVERYWHERE, willing to help and open doors, and let you off the elevator first, and get you whatever you need and call you by your name. We came over after staying at Embassy Suites, which was a great great great hotel as well. I believe that the atmosphere here is a bit stuffy, with a lot of roaming business people who tend to make the ambiance pretty tense. When walking into the $22 p/person breakfast buffet (which was pretty good), we were sort of looked down upon. The stares we got by other guests were not at all friendly. Being from New York, it was very easy for us to laugh it off though. But it was still a very uncomfortable feeling for both my boyfriend and I. Anyway, the pool is absolutely breathtaking. Those chairs will put you right to sleep. Fresh citrus water and fruits were always available to keep you cool. The Ritz's private beach is a few steps from the pool and is just as beautiful. Since its a private beach, it is one the best places to relax. Go Kayaking or sailing. It is included with your stay and since you're on vacation, make the most of it. Don't forget to relax on the hammoks too. Although food is expensive, you have to expect it when you stay here. We ate at the hotel only once for the breakfast. We also ate at Denny's 1 day which was just around the corner. Plaza las Americas was a 15min. ride and perfect if it happens to rain. Some of the staff is friendly, while some offer their services with a fake smile...we tried to joke around to relax some of them, but I guess they are just not used to it. All in all, I think I would stay here again but only for an anniversary or special occasion. Despite the weird stares and tense atmosphere, it is a beautiful hotel, and the rooms definintly make you feel like royalty. I agree with 1 review, the water pressure wasn't all that high. But the robe and marble counters and floors made up for it.
reviews.title: A memorabe experience
Ritz Carlton
reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from an anniversary trip to San Juan where we stayed at the Ritz Carlton. We got a good price on our room through a special we found. Normally we could not afford to stay at a hotel like the Ritz and it was a real treat. I read many reviews before our departure and did not encounter any plane noise or thin walls that the reviews noted. The employees at the Ritz were fantastic and they went out of their way to make sure everything was to our liking. We walked a little ways down the street and found affordable restaurants like Denny's, Metropol, and Mi Casita for all of our meals. The area around the hotel was not that great, but after all, you are not in the continental US. Anyone who has traveled to any of the islands would understand that the way of life if just a little different. We loved Old San Juan, visited El Yunque, and enjoyed our hotel. We hope to go back soon!

We stayed at the Ritz Carlton San Juan from Friday, 9/29 until Monday, 10/2. The service was head and shoulders above any other hotel we have stayed at. The location is very near the airport but that enabled us to enjoy more time there during our short weekend stay. We heard the airplanes but, even though our room faced the airport, they never woke us up or bothered us. The casino was fun and very laid back if you are used to Vegas or Atlantic City -- slow dealers, free drinks and food!
reviews.title: Now I know what 5-star means!!

reviews.text: One MINOR complaint; the water pressure in our room was terrible. Others we traveled with said the same thing. If you want better (but still not great) shower pressure, use the shower in the spa/fitness center.
reviews.title: Fantastic Trip - Unforgettable Time
excellent experience
reviews.text: We stayed at the ritz for a week in march 05. The hotel is beautiful and the staff could not be more friendly. Every request was honored with pleasure. Pool area is very nice, and the hotel being on the beach is a nice plus. The food/drinks are very pricey, so finding other areas to dine/drink is recommended if you are on a budget. The intercontinental hotel, which we walked to from the ritz (~5-10min walk) houses ruth's chris steak house and momoyama japanese cuisine, both very good. The 101 lounge is a nice little hole in the wall type bar right next to the ritz. Great for grabbing a drink at about 1/8th the price of the ritz, literally. lupis is a mexican/sport bar restaurant about two or so blocks from the ritz, again, good food and great price. They also had a cover band playing when we went and seemed to have good music other nights when we walked by. Walking to these areas we felt safe as there always seemed to be a police presence.

So given the overall quality of the Ritz and not feeling discouraged by finding other areas to eat aside from the in-house restaurants, I highly recommend the ritz in san juan as a place to stay. I would not hesitate returning.
reviews.title: The best place to relax
A Ritz is a Ritz...
reviews.text: Let me start by saying I am a very critical person, but there is nothing to criticize about the Ritz. The beach was fabulous, there was great live music at the pool and the lobby lounge, and the casino was a lot of fun. There was a tic-tac-toe game with a live chicken (a better use of chickens than the cockfighting arena near the hotel) and we beat the chicken! Nobody on the staff or the other guests was snooty. The native Puerto Ricans who were at the casino were extremely friendly, especially when I played the free bingo game with numbers called out in Spanish and incomprehensible English. We barely had a desire to leave the hotel for food or anything else, although we did venture to Old San Juan and the rainforest for nice outings, but being at the hotel was better. If you want to relax and not be bothered by anyone, and have everything handed to you on a silver platter, this is the place!

reviews.title: What's not to like
reviews.text: We had a great stay as you come to expect from the Ritz Hotels. The service is excellent... recommend the club level with great food throughout the day. The club level will actually save you money with breakfeast, lunch and cocktails provided. The pool is very nice. Small beachfront, but the nicest in the area. The Sushi restaurant and the seafood buffet were excellent. This is not the serene, isolated carribean get away but an excellent retreat for those who want instant access to warm weather with a short connection from the US.

reviews.title: Has it all
reviews.text: My wife and I and our two children just returned from a stay at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan (February 19-22) and like they say, "it's the Ritz, what's not to like." Actually, on a scale of 1 to 10 I would give it a 9. Although I rate the hotel five stars (excellent) on the rating scale, I did so only because the four star rating is for above average and in my opinion the hotel is closer to excellent than above average. Prior to arriving at the Ritz, we stayed two nights at the Marriott in Condado Beach. Although the Marriott now owns and/operates the Ritz Carlton chain, there is no comparison between the two properties. With that said, we did have an oceanfront room at the Marriott (which allowed us to sleep with the balcony doors open) and were unable to get one at the Ritz. However, that turned out to be a blessing in disguise. With the exception of a few rooms at the Ritz, none of them have balconies and the windows do not open and we were on the so-called garden-view side of the hotel at $550.00/night and the rooms facing the water were even pricier with no real added benefit. Some reviews talked about the hotel's proximity to the airport which is great when arriving and leaving any really had little, if any, effect on our stay. Although you could hear the occasional airplane taking off when at the pool, it was not a negative. Everthing that others are writing about the hotel is pretty accurate. The staff is as friendly as can be, the hotel and grounds are immaculate, the bathrooms and rooms are very nice and meals at the hotel are expensive. We were somewhat disappointed that our room (612) had a large coffee stain in the middle of the carpet and the carpet in general was somewhat dirty but after pointing this out, someone from the hotel quickly came and scrubbed out much of the coffee stain but truth be told, the entire carpet really needed to be cleaned. We had dinner two nights in the lobby restaurant which also allows you to order from the Chinese restaurant in the casino which we could not eat at because the kids are not allowed in the casino. The first dinner was great but the dinner order the second time was completely messed up (after waiting almost an hour to get it) and the hotel insisted on not charging us for the dinner which was nice. My only real complaint is that the pool did not appear to be heated and was very cold. In fact, the only people in the pool were kids and most guests (including the kids) simply used the jacuzzi. Perhaps in the summer a heated pool is unnecessary but not so in February. Other than that, the hotel was great and we would definitely stay there again.

reviews.title: Service with a smile
reviews.text: Spent a few days at the Ritz (first time at this hotel) 12/7/05 - 12/11/05 with my husband, 2 daughters (11 and 9), and my parents to unwind after 4 days at Disney World. What a treat! Service with a smile - and incredible food, rooms, spa, beach, pool, etc. Just what we were looking for and it was right there at all times. While it is a bit pricey for food, it is well worth the price for the pampering. The staff is extremely accommodating and never harried, always pleasant and extremely professional. A pleasurable time for everyone in our diverse party. We expecially loved seeing the iguanas around the pool area - Ritz iguanas are a breed unto themselves!

reviews.title: Property Ok; Service Amazing
reviews.text: We stayed for a week in December. Overall execellent. On the downside, they took over an older property and therefore the building is a little worn. My biggest problem with the building is that most rooms have no balcony (the few rooms that do are a FORTUNE). In a place like PR, it's nice to have a balcony to unwind on in the morning or evening and hear the crash of the waves. Without a balcony, you feel a little captive in your room. Also, the rooms on the east side face an apartment building. You should definitely pay the few extra dollars for a pool view. Ask for a high floor as well so that you will also have a view of the ocean.

That being said, on the service side, this place in a Ritz all the way. You will not find better service in PR. Every staff member treats you like a king. No questions asked. Nothing you ask for is ever a problem. The beach is beutiful too. The casino is very nice and open all the time. In sum, what this hotel lacks in terms of property it gains (and then some) in service.
reviews.title: Don't Be Swayed

reviews.text: Overrated. Essentially, this is a Sheraton/Marriott with Ritz prices. While certainly nothing bad, this hotel does not rise to the level of expectation for something called a Ritz Carlton. The rooms are nothing special, and the service is only adequate. Our sheets were not changed in our rooms, turn-down service was basically asking if we needed more towels, and all food service was slow. Again, there's nothing ultimately wrong with that, but I certainly expect more when I pay Ritz prices. Food is fine, but the pool bar uses a machine for the frozen drinks, not a blender. Which works, just not what I expect or necessarily prefer for what I pay.

reviews.text: I spent a few days at the Ritz Carlton in San Juan last year. I went to visit some friends who have a beautiful home outside of San Juan and brought back a bunch of beautiful flowers from their garden, to put on a vase in my room. A day before my departure, another good friend came over to visit and I asked him to take the flowers with him, so that they would not go to waste. On his way down the elevator, one of the hotel managers made a sarcastic comment complementing the flowers. On his way out by the beach, the pool staff again asked him where he had obtained the flowers from. He explained. When he was about to get into his car, a security guard stopped him and again asked about the flowers. My friend was finally let go, but we were left with a sour taste in our mouths. We support security, but wasn't this a bit ridiculous? Otherwise, the pool is HEAVENLY. The beach just ok.

reviews.title: Very Nice For What It Is: An Urban Resort
reviews.text: We have just returned from a four-day stay at this hotel. The previous reviews of this and other San Juan hotels left us puzzled, so I thought I'd try to provide the straight scoop. This is a very fine URBAN resort hotel, with a pleasant beach attached as a bonus. There is no question that this is the finest hotel in San Juan, and the staff is well trained and generally eager to provide a lovely experience. As an added bonus, the hotel is a pleasant five-minute walk from the El San Juan, which has fabulous nightlife in its elegant lobby. BUT: This is not the Caribbean resort of your dreams -- it is basically urban. If you need or want to stay in San Juan itself (as we did) this is beyond any dispute the finest choice you could make. (The closest competitors in San Juan, such as the Marriott or the Water Club, are pale imitations of the Ritz and nowhere near as nice.) However, Puerto Rico does offer many other high-end "beach resorts" some distance away -- typically, 1-2 hours drive outside of San Juan. If you're looking for a typical luxury Caribbean resort, you may be happier at one of those choices (Horned Dorset, Wyndham in Farjado, etc.). If you have already decided in stay in San Juan itself, howver, the Ritz is absolutely your best choice. BTW, if you're in San Juan, go for dinner at Pikayo -- rated, for good reason, as one of the top 100 restaurants in the world for 2003.

We truly enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Ritz Carlton on Carolina beach in San Juan. They were nice enough to upgrade us to a Jr Suite on the 7th floor with overlooking the pool & the beautiful beach. The room was nicely decorated and had a very large bathroom. We inspected our sheets very closely and they didn't have any holes like the other TripAdvisor guests had complained about. The nightly turn down service was a nice touch as well. The pool and beach were both very clean and there were plenty of available chairs in either the sun or the shade. The poolside wait staff was very slow (waited 30 minutes with the flag up and no one stopped) which was also a bit disappointing.

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went to San Juan to ring in the New Year. We stayed at the Ritz which is in Isla Verde. I had a good time overall. The service was excellent throughout our stay. We were there from Dec. 30 until January 3. We knew the staff by name by the time we left and they knew us by name. There were a lot of families there with small children which surprised me. However, I didn't see it as a problem and actually enjoyed watching the little ones enjoy themselves in the pool. Isla Verde is not a resort area. We had a 3rd floor room with really no view for about $800/night. The room was very standard but clean. We didn't expect to spend a substantial time in the room anyway. We just wanted to stay in a nice hotel with such amenities. Unlike the other premium hotels on the strip, the Ritz was overall quiet and only frequented by the guests of the hotel. Intercontinental and El San Juan had too much going on for my taste because of all of the attractions in the hotels. Also, the Ritz provided every service that you can possibly imagine. This allowed the guests to retreat in the hotel for the duration of their stay if they liked. The casino was nothing to write home about but if you are a gambler I guess it will be ok. I am not a gambler. The spa services were ridiculously overpriced. I am unsure if the prices quoted to me were holiday prices or everyday prices. I just believe that a manicure and pedicure for $160 is absolutely RIDICULOUS. Although it was extremely pricy for the holidays, I definitely enjoyed the Ritz. If I went back again, I think I would stay in Old San Juan because it is less touristy and feels like you are on an island with rich history and tradition....plus I may be able to find a cheaper yet still enjoyable experience.

We recently returned from a one week stay at the Ritz Carlton, and the key phrase for this review is "my pleasure". We arrived at the hotel on a Thursday afternoon. As we stepped out of the taxi we were warmly greeted and our luggage quickly collected. In the short check-in line, tropical fruit juice and cold hand towels were waiting for us. We stayed in a standard room on the 3rd floor, which was spacious enough for myself, my wife, and our 14-month old daughter. The room had the standard comfortable beds, nice sheets, and quality bath amenities that you could expect from a Ritz, along with newly installed flat-panel TVs. We had a nice view of the gardens and some of the pool area, but had to crane our necks for the ocean view. Our requests for a refrigerator and a crib were met soon after we settled in, with an unsolicited offer from the porter to try and get us an upgraded room. Be aware that the hotel is close to the airport, so it is not a resort in the middle of nowhere, but rather an oasis in the city that might be subject to some runway noise. The beach is ok, with large hammocks and beach chairs available. The pool area is lovely, with plenty of available lounge chairs. The pool attendants were great, laying out towels, moving umbrellas and setting up the playpens/portable cribs that are available. One thing that surprised us was the number of people that went to the pool desk, got towels and avoided the attendants. Another surprise was the number of kids under 5 that were there over the weekend. We thought we'd be one of the only ones, but for those first few days, the pool area was full, with a good number of small kids. Throughout Sunday evening and Monday morning, many of the weekenders with kids packed up, and the hotel transitioned to a decidely more business, less leisure guest mix. This left the pool area more sparsly poulated and quiet for the remainder of our trip. Throughout our stay, the hotel was 95% full, but you could never tell. We found that the hotel did not nickel and dime on the whole, although there were some exceptions. For example, the hotel provided free bottled water in the rooms, with extra bottles available on request. Some items at the pool like soft drinks and fries were actually reasonable for a luxury hotel. On the other hand, the $6 ice cream bar was a bit excessive. Breakfast was $23, expensive if you are eating at home, but what you might expect at a quality hotel with a fairly comprehensive buffet. You can also order specific entrees like 2 eggs, toast and hash browns for $10, but order anything additional (juice, cereal, etc.) and it starts to make sense to pay for the buffet and have all the variety. The concierge was helpful in arranging babysitting, dinner reservations, and providing general travel information. What really made our trip was the responsive service level provided by the entire staff. We were always greeted with a warm hello or good morning. Virtually no request was refused, and service was delivered promptly and always with a smile and "my pleasure". To put it simply, much of the staff knew our daughter by name, and seemed to genuinely enjoy playing with her, and seeing to our needs. Overall, I would say this ranks among the top hotels I have stayed in. If you are looking for a more isolated location, or a self-enclosed megaresort this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a low-key luxury experience, then this is your place.

As this was our first stay, I asked many people who have been going there for many years, and almost all said what I felt and many said that they would not return. The rooms are fine (that is after we were moved from our room as there was mold under the windows and on the carpet.....gross). Internet is VERY spotty. What amazed us was that we were told that the hotel was full yet not all the restaurants were open. Be sure to book them ahead of time and stay far away from "Mare" the seafood restaurant. Prices were very inflated as it is a Ritz, but come on 18 for a pool side hot dog and 22 for a pool side ceasar salad with chicken? The magic question is would I return..........the answer is NO.

2) We had a standard room which could be used as an adjoining room. I could hear the man whistling "Little Drummer Boy" - that's not right. We were woken up at 1:30 AM when the couple returned from a night out; they received 4 phone calls within 20 minutes and we heard every word of every call. That should not happen at a Ritz. reviews.title: Great restaurants!!! Caribbean Grill and Vineyard were great!!!
reviews.text: I've read all the reviews that said that most of the staff at this hotel couldn't speak good english, and all I have to say to that is that it was all bull! It was my wife's and I anniversary, and we decided to eat at the Vineyard, there we were greeted by a beautiful tall, blonde Puertorican woman named Lizzie (by the way she looked like she was from France, not Puerto Rico and spoke PERFECT english). My wife then wanted to know where the Casino was and Lizzie very kindly, left her stand and escorted my wife all the way to the casino. To top that off, after we left, we were curious about all the other restaurants on the property, we asked the hostess and not only did she show us the menu of each, but she also showed us to them!!! The next day, we saw her at the Caribbean Grill (she seems to be an all around girl). She welcomed us by name, asked us how we spent out anniversary and sat us in a great table. Then we were greeted by an excellent waiter named Christopher who also spoke perfect english and got us our order promptly and efficiently. The only complaint I have is with housekeeping, who are a bit slow and they REALLY need to work on their english, and room service, which are a little slow (but the food was still very good). I had a little trouble with the check in, but the agent (another beautiful blonde) was very polite and courteous and excused herself for the inconvenience. I have stayed in the water club, and there all the women are beautiful and know it and they treat you like it is your priviledge to speak to them. Their english is terrible and the service is slow. reviews.title: Diverse Guests, Wonderful Hotel and Staff
reviews.text: Like many others, I was perplexed by the contradictory reviews offered for this hotel... until I went. The Ritz San Juan is a beautiful property with wonderfully pleasant staff, particularly the club level staff. We had a very nice stay and would return in a heartbeat. The guests were as varied as the reviews before you. Many were very pleasant, but many were quite demanding and obnoxious toward the staff. A lesson to take with you wherever you may go- treat others as you would like to be treated and it will pay great dividends. Don't let the poor reviews keep you from this wonderful hotel.

THe Ritz sits on the ocean and you can look out certain windows of the property and see the landing strip of the airport. We never heard planes while inside our room but did hear them outside by the pool area. The sound varied depending upon the traffic route. I think I was expecting Isla Verde to be a little bit more like Cancun- I knew it would have more of an urgan 'strip' hotel feel but was really disappointed by the neighborhood the Ritz is in. Tons of litter in areas outside the Ritz, sidewalks not easily navigatable. We walked to the El SAn Juan and my 9 year old had to literally step over a drunk guy whose feet were sticking out of an alley. The pool area was okay, but actually not as impressive as others. There were always seats to be had, although the seats themselves are packed pretty tightly together and in rows. I thought the water temperature in the pool was fine.

We had booked an Executive suite at $975 a night. Our view was really high rise (and often) run down apartment buildings or other resorts. The bedroom area was beautiful but the living room area was not as attractive. Only in picture and the rest bare walls. A low level cabiner holding a TV, so that the top of the TV was no higher than the top of the coffee table. Why didn't they just use the taller units that are found in the bedrooms. The sofa can convert to a sofa bed, but was not comfortable at all if using as an actual sofa. We asked to be switched and booked 2 adjoining oceanview rooms for a bit more money. The front desk staff handled this very well. However, when we checked out they had continued to charge us $975 plus $489 for the second room. The King bedded room should have been $600. This took a while to manually rectify at checkout. Our cleaning and turn down service was fabulous. We also tip every day and I think that makes a big difference. Others said they got great service by attendants pool-side but we didn't see much of that during our stay. Again, I am comparing this to other Ritz properties. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been going to the Ritz since it opened 12 years ago. Yes it always takes some time at check-in before your room is ready; we bring a carry on with a change of clothes and use the spa to change clothes. This is the best resort in San Juan, others do not come close. We tried a few and were disappointed. We always stay on the club floor and it feels like home when we arrive. The club staff is always there to take care of your needs. We have breakfast and lunch on the club and usually grab a cocktail before heading out for dinner. Many people eat all meals and desserts on the club as well. We ate at IL Mulino twice this year and the service and quality of food is fantastic. We had Valentine’s dinner there and it was awesome. Ruth’s Chris steakhouse is nearby at the intercontinental and Morton’s is a short taxi ride at the Hilton. There are many excellent restaurants in Old San Juan as well. We usually spend one afternoon shopping (Coach, Polo, Guess, Burberry and many more). I would rather use the beach instead and just relax. San Juan has a feeling of being in a city with a tropical feel; you have to know this before going. Many people are disappointed about all the buildings, the airport etc. We like looking at the planes taking off while you are swimming in the ocean, others complain about the noise. The resort has a city feel as well, many of the rooms do not have balconies. The rooms are very clean (never had a bad experience) and the cleaning staff is great. Call them when you check-in a let them know what time you want your room cleaned and turned down, they will accommodate all requests. Keep an open mind as well, many guests think that just because they are staying at a Ritz Carlton that they should be treated like royalty. Be prepared to spend money, nothing good is cheap. If paying $20 for a burger is not your thing, then don’t come here!

reviews.title: 92 Dollar per day Resort Fee From Hell

reviews.text: This is your basic Ritz, a nice hotel, service is spotty. We only had three nights away from our kids and paid top dollar for ocean front club level -- 659 dollars a night. Check in was bumpy -- at 2:45 pm we waited in line downstairs for fifteen minutes then were whisked up to club level where we waited another twenty minutes to be told by a rather surly woman that our room was not ready and "we have till four come back at four" It went on and an until I requested the front desk manager who found us a room immediately. Rest of stay was uneventful, until we got our bill and discovered we were being charged $92.26 PER DAY for a "resort fee". The room tax was only 89 dollars a day. I have stayed in Ritz hotels all over the world and sometimes they charge you 25 bucks a day for a "resort fee" but $92.26? Apparently they add fifteen percent to your bill to tip the bellman and pool guys (who we tip anyway). The front desk manager on duty did not return our call. My husband had to go down and fight with them for an hour to resolve the issue. It was a nightmare. Not a good way to end a romantic trip. I am in the process of writing to the corporate headquarters and the hotel GM to express my indignation. As a result of this experience I will probably not ever stay in another Ritz again --- there are other choices in the high end luxury market that do not try to tack exorbitant fees onto the bills of loyal guests who are already paying top dollar. BE WARNED BEFORE YOU BOOK!!

reviews.text: This is a great hotel for either business or vacation – expensive, but nice. I stayed at the Ritz Carlton from Nov 28 - Dec 2. The first 2 days we held a business meeting there and we were all impressed with the hotel rooms, the meeting rooms and the service. The meeting rooms had wireless internet service and the business lunches were very good. The corporate rate was amazing: $165 (it amounted to $200 after taxes and resort fee, which is still a great deal). We didn’t get a room with a balcony, but the rooms still had a combination water view/pool view. Our prior meeting was held at the Caribe Hilton and this is a much better place to go for a meeting. We had dinner at the Italian restaurant in the hotel (Il Mulino)– very good and very expensive. The portions are extremely large, so if you’re in a group I suggest sharing entrees or ordering the appetizer sized portions. The last 2 days of my trip my sister joined me for a few days of vacation. I was able to get the corporate rate for the remaining 2 days – what a deal! I got a pedicure at the spa – even though I e-mailed my request for a spa treatment without the 24-hour notice, they were able to accommodate me at the requested time. The posted rate was $75 but it ended up costing around $95 by the time they added tip and tax. This was the most I have spent on a pedicure – I hope it lasts. The spa service was friendly and professional. The fitness center was great and the classes were very good – not easy at all. If you take a few classes a day you are bound to return fitter than you arrived. Most of the cardio equipment had their own TVs. All headphones were cleaned after use. Water bottles and fresh towels were placed on all pieces of equipment, and the instructors would hand out cold bottles. The one negative about the fitness center was they only had 2 elliptical machines (which everyone wanted to use), and they were very much in need of service, making loud banging noises if someone used them. I found the noise quite annoying while I was exercising - They should have placed “out of service” notices on them. The pool and the beach were nice. There was just one pool and one hot tub, but there always seemed to be available chairs. There were always lots of towel guys hanging around to find you a chair. My only complaint about the pool area was the lack of beverage/food service. There were only a few people taking food and drink orders – not enough to cover everyone. Not one approached us to ask us if we wanted something – we had to chase them down or go to the bar and order on our own. I found this surprising because the ratio of hotel service people to guests was extremely high throughout the rest of the hotel – twice when I asked how to find something ( a restaurant or meeting room), someone took the time to walk me there. The rooms were nice. The air conditioning was adjustable and there were flat screen TVs and free internet. The one thing we didn’t like about the rooms was the lack of an internal privacy lock and lack of “do not disturb” signs (called “shh” signs in the hotel). Our room did not have a “shh” sign, and a member of the housekeeping staff walked in on my sister while she was getting dressed. We then asked for a “shh” sign for the door, which disappeared the next day (perhaps taken by another guest who needed one). I would prefer a privacy lock on the door. I had an evening flight, and the hotel provides “changing rooms” rather than let you check out beyond 1:30 PM. Overall, this was a very nice hotel, which is why I’m taking the time to write this, and I would definitely go back. This hotel is highly recommended for business travel and for a business meeting location. It’s also a nice place for vacation travelers who aren’t pinching pennies and are OK with $24 breakfasts and $14 pina coladas.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz June 23rd-28th, 2006. Don't listen to the reviews telling you not to stay at the Ritz. It is an excellent hotel with top-notch service, especially in comparison with the other hotels San Juan has to offer. We arrived in San Juan and checked in at the El San Juan (hotel next to Ritz) - at 3 am, with music still blaring from the pool deck keeping my husband and I awake, I called the Ritz and booked the rest of our vacation with them. We got to the hotel at 10:30am, and we're treated like royalty from the first minute we stepped out of the taxi. They took our baggage, insisted we eat a delicious breakfast, and had us in our room when we arrived! You are in Puerto Rico and if you have any cultural experience, you should know what to expect. It's not Hawaii, but that's not why you should go there. I've stayed in nicer Ritz's, but I've also paid A LOT more. You won't find a better hotel in Puerto Rico, and it's still a wonderful resort. Food was great at all restaurants - especially Prime 787. If we return to San Juan, we'll be staying here, hands down, there is no contest.

Good Deal if you Get a Discount
reviews.text: I was able to book this hotel at a pretty substantial discount (under $200). At the discounted rate, this was a great hotel. But if I had paid $400+ a night, I would have been pretty upset and bitter about the whole situation. The hotel room is a typical Ritz Carlton room, and has a large bathroom and a flat screen tv. Very few rooms have balconies and the windows don't look like they've been washed in 10 years. But the real problem with the room is that you can literally hear everything in the neighboring rooms. If your neighbors decide to watch tv at 2:00 am, then you will hear it. If your neighbors have a baby and it decides to cry in the night (happened twice for me), you will wake up too. If you want to sleep until 10 am and your neighbors wake up at 7 am and decide to have a normal conversation, you will not be sleeping in that morning. Its like being in a motel! That being said, the pool is gorgeous (but crowded on the weekends) and the beach is really nice too. We had hit or miss service in terms of getting beverage service at the beach/pool. I think its because its a little understaffed. Given I paid less than $200 a night, that was ok with me. If I had paid double the price.... then it would have been upsetting. The beach water isn't quite as pretty as other Caribbean islands. Oh, and its a $19 taxi ride each way into Old San Juan, which adds up! And a $17 per day resort fee, which is sneaky, in my opinion. While the food at the hotel was pricey, I didn't think it was any more outrageous than any other resort hotel. Given all this, I would definitely go back as long as I could book at a discount. I thought the staff was very friendly and the hotel did try to add a lot of those extra touches that differentiates a 3-star from a 4-star hotel.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 5 nights, at a significant corporate discount. Without the discount, I don't think we would have been quite so happy, but with the discount, we were pleased. The room was clean and spacious, the beds very comfortable, and the staff was really pleasant. The pool was extremely crowded our first day there (a Sunday) but that did not happen again during the rest of our stay (we left on a Friday). And you always had the option of having chairs set out for you on the beach, which was really nice. The pool was also great, and the grounds are beautiful. we even saw some very cool lizards running around, and at night, if you walk around you can hear the frogs singing. The little touches are nice - like the NY Times supplement, the fruit at the towel stand, the fact that at any given time, staff were always around and were always helpful. The casino (and the whole hotel) is now non-smoking, and that was great too. I think overall it is a great place to relax and get away, with very easy beach and pool access that is comfortable and clean.

reviews.title: Disappointing. Terrible. Horrific.
reviews.text: The property was beautiful, especially the pool area and lobby. It is true that the rooms could use some updating - especially new carpet - but our room and bathroom was large (at least for our NYC standards), comfortable, clean, and nicely decorated. We had no trouble getting a king size bed, and another reviewer put it nicely, it was "like sleeping on a cloud". On the weekdays, housekeeping was a little slow to get to our room (twice it was not done by 4pm), one night we did not receive turndown service, and I had to call to get new bathrobes when housekeeping removed them and forgot to replace. This didn't bother us too much since we were rarely in the room during the day, and during the weekend the housekeeping staff was much more on top of it. The pool area was indeed crowded, but we were always able to find chairs (even getting there late morning/early afternoon). There is some airplane noise on the beach, less at the pool, and we never noticed it inside the hotel. The beach is beautiful, but windy - at least when we were there - and they have nice hammocks set up under the palms. We did not eat dinner at the hotel restaurants, preferring to head into Old San Juan, but the breakfast at the Caribbean Grill was always delicious.

Also had very tasty Cuban food at Metropole (5 min. walk from hotel) - and for $35 for two people, dinner, beer, and dessert, it's a great deal for a casual meal. The nightlife at the Ritz is pretty quiet, except for the casino on the weekend. However, a very happening bar/nightclub scene is only a short walk away at the El San Juan. That was a fun place to spend an evening, but I don't think I'd want to stay there as a guest. Overall, the Ritz was exactly what we were looking for - a peaceful, beautiful place to enjoy the sun and be pampered. For us, the few problems were merely momentary annoyances, and did not affect our enjoyment of the vacation. We would definitely stay there again, and highly recommend it to others.

reviews.text: Service was so so. Getting drinks at pool took a while and the cost was siginifcant. Pool attendents set up chairs, umbrella and towels for you, but expected a tip. Chairs were nice and padded, but were often wet due to rain or people sitting on with wet clothes. I found this annoying, even when extra towels were placed on chairs they eventually soaked through.

aka: Ritz-Carlton San Juan Hotel, Spa And Casino
